metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14614 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.10. There is an out-of-bounds access in __remove_dirty_segment() in fs/f2fs/segment.c when mounting an f2fs image. Wen Xu discovered that the f2fs file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate metadata. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1014-azure - 5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> The affected user base for this issue is likely small since f2fs is not the default filesystem and it is not widely used in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1').
